Key Arguments: The individual values access to a wide range of information available through digital platforms.
They believe in using personal judgment and consulting trusted sources for verifying information.
They express concern about government overreach and its impact on freedom of speech.
They argue that existing defamation and criminal laws are sufficient to manage harmful commentary.
They advocate for minimal government intervention, suggesting that adults should be free to decide what information to believe.
Notable Quotes: I do not want any government in this country or elsewhere to impinge on freedom of speech.
Defamation laws and criminal laws are sufficient to keep commentary in check.
Use a scalpel and the criminal law to weed out information harmful to children and leave the adults to make up their own minds.
